p:
The stemborers, B. fusca, S. calamistis and C. partellus are the most important pests of maize in Kenya
9 . The three stemborers frequently occur as single or mixed species communities
11, 12 whose structure varies with agro-ecological zones. Busseola fusca is generally the dominant species in the highlands, while C. partellus dominates in the lowlands
6, 26 , and S. calamistis occurs at all altitudes
27 . These stemborer species often occur as a mixed community of the three species in the mid-altitudinal regions
7, 12 . Spodoptera frugiperda, since its first report in the western region of Kenya in 2017, has been confirmed throughout the different agro-ecological zones by the early cropping season in 2018
28 .
